definition: one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2

definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 yan1 zhi1 fei1 fu2
ji2 ren2 zi4 you3 tian1 xiang4

definition: Heaven never bars one's way (idiom); don't despair and you will find a way through./Never give up hope./Never say die.
pinyin: tian1 wu2 jue2 ren2 zhi1 lu4

definition: see 吉人自有天相[ji2 ren2 zi4 you3 tian1 xiang4]
to profit from a disaster (idiom); some good comes out of a setback/It's an ill wind that blows nobody any good.
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert disaster
evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
true sentiments are seen in hard times (idiom)/you see who your true friends are when you go through tough times together/you see who your true friends are when you are in difficulties
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
